Sentencas: The oxygen uptake ability of Pr-CeO2-based oxygen carriers, catalysts, and solid oxide fuel cells can be attributed to 3+ cation generation and the presence of vacant oxygen sites.
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: Oxygen occupancies of CeO2, Pr-CeO2, and 5% Cu-doped Pr-CeO2 were investigated using neutron diffraction and related to the oxygen uptake as determined using thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: The presence of vacant tetrahedral oxygen sites at room temperature did not correspond to low-temperature oxygen uptake.
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: The materials is did not uptake oxygen at 420 degrees C, but oxygen uptake was observed at 600 degrees C, which indicated that a minimum temperature needs to be met to generate sufficient vacancies/3+ cations.
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: Variations in the lattice parameter as a function of temperature were revealed using in situ X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: With increasing temperature the lattice parameter increased linearly due to thermal expansion and was followed by an exponential increase at similar to 300-400 degrees C as cations were reduced.
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: Despite segregation of Cu into CuO at high dopant concentration, at 600 degrees C a higher O-2 uptake was obtained for Ce0.65Pr0.20Cu0.15O2-delta (120 mu mol g(-1)), in comparison to Ce0.75Pr0.2Cu0.05O2-delta (92 mu mol g(-1)), and was higher than that for Ce0.8Pr0.2O2-delta (55 mu mol g(-1)).
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction

Sentencas: Both Pr and Cu introduce vacancies and promote the O-2 uptake of CeO2.
Titulo: Vacancy Generation and Oxygen Uptake in Cu-Doped Pr-CeO2 Materials using Neutron and in Situ X-ray Diffraction
